headline: 75% of Recent and Prospective Homebuyers Are Concerned About Homeowners Insurance Becoming Unaffordable, New Realtor.com® Survey
summary: As more than one in four homes in the U.S.—representing $12.7 trillion in real estate value—risk exposure to severe or extreme climate risks, nearly half of recent and prospective homebuyers have faced trouble or expect to face trouble obtaining or renewing homeowners insurance, according to a recent Realtor.com® survey. Eighty-eight percent of those surveyed believe that they will pay for more homeowners insurance in the future and 42 percent have already confirmed they have experienced a rise
